synopsis: After the sudden death of their parents, Haruka and his twin sister Sora move to their grandparents' house, hoping to create a new life with old, and new, friends.
Sora finally starts attending school with Haruka, though she is disappointed to find that she and Haruka are in different classes. Does Haruka misinterpret a conversation he was not meant to hear?
Even as Kazuha is guilt-ridden and upset over Akira's standing, Haruka determines that a date with Kazuha might make the whole situation better.
Kazuha and Akira have a deep connection, one that only they acknowledge. Haruka is instrumental in providing some clarity to Kazuha's misconceptions.
Has Haruka misunderstood the message he heard on the cellphone? Has he jumped to the wrong conclusion?
Akira and Kazuha finally get some answers, as a DNA test prompts Kazuha's mother to divulge her secret.
Nao is driven to explain her past actions. Do they impact her current relationship?
Sora is consumed with hatred, even as Haruka seems to be oblivious to the depth of her feelings---and his own.
Sora becomes even more insecure when she learns the details of a drowning accident that almost took the life of her brother.
Nao is beginning to see her relationship with different eyes, giving her a clearer picture of the two siblings.
Sora is finally able to explain her actions and feelings to her brother, even as Nao is left to wonder where her relationship is heading.
The twins finally make peace with their relationship, as friends and lovers begin to understand the siblings.
